exception zim.notebook.index.base.IndexConsistencyError¶

Bases: AssertionError

Error used when a lookup fails while expected to succeed

exception zim.notebook.index.base.IndexNotFoundError¶

Bases: ValueError

Error used when lookup fails because a pagename does not appear in the index.

class zim.notebook.index.base.TreeModelMixinBase(index)¶

Bases: zim.signals.ConnectorMixin

This class can be used as mixin class for Gtk.TreeModel implementations that use data from the index.

Treepaths are simply tuples with integers. This Mixin assumes MyTreeIter objects for iters. (Which should not be confused with Gtk.TreeIter as used by the interface!)

connect_to_updateiter(update_iter)¶

Connect to a new IndexUpdateIter

The following signals must be implemented:

  • row-inserted (treepath, treeiter)

  • row-changed (treepath, treeiter)

  • row-has-child-toggled (treepath, treeiter)

  • row-deleted (treepath)

Typically each signal should also flush the cache using self.cache.clear().

Implementation

must be implemented by a subclass

find(obj)¶

Return the treepath for a index object like a Path or IndexTag

Raises

IndexNotFoundError – if indexpath is not found

Implementation

must be implemented by a subclass

find_all(obj)¶

Like find() but can return multiple results

Implementation

must be implemented by subclasses that have mutiple entries for the same object. Default falls back to result of find().

get_mytreeiter(treepath)¶

Returns a treeiter object for treepath or None

Implementation

must be implemented by a subclass

n_children_top()¶

Return the number of items in the top level of the model

class zim.notebook.index.files.FilesIndexChecker(db, folder)¶

Bases: object

check_iter()¶

Generator function that walks existing records and flags records that are not longer valid. Yields in between checks to allow embedding in a loop.

Returns

Yields True when an out of date record is found.

Bases: zim.signals.SignalEmitter

Class that will update the “files” table in the index based on changes seen on the file system.

Signal

file-row-inserted (row, file): on new file found

Signal

file-row-changed (row, file): on file content changed

Signal

file-row-deleted (row): on file deleted

class zim.notebook.index.links.LinksView(db)¶

Bases: zim.notebook.index.base.IndexView

list_floating_links(basename)¶
list_links(pagename, direction=1)¶

Generator listing links between pages

Parameters

  • pagename – the Path for which to list links

  • direction –

    the link direction to be listed. This can be one of:

    • LINK_DIR_FORWARD: for links from path

    • LINK_DIR_BACKWARD: for links to path

    • LINK_DIR_BOTH: for links from and to path

Returns

yields IndexLink objects

Raises

IndexNotFoundError – if path is not found in the index

The following signals must be implemented:

  • row-inserted (treepath, treeiter)

  • row-changed (treepath, treeiter)

  • row-has-child-toggled (treepath, treeiter)

lookup_from_user_input(name, reference=None)¶

Lookup a pagename based on user input

Parameters

  • name – the user input as string

  • reference – a Path in case relative links are supported as customer input

Returns

a Path object for name

Raises

  • ValueError – when name would reduce to empty string after removing all invalid characters, or if name is a relative link while no reference page is given.

  • IndexNotFoundError – when reference is not indexed

Like match_pages() except not limited a specific namespace

  • limit – max number of results

yields Path objects for children of path

resolve_link(source, href)¶

Find the end point of a link Depending on the link type (absolute, relative, or floating), this method first determines the starting point of the link path. Then it goes downward doing a case insensitive match against the index.

Parameters

  • source – a Path for the starting point of the link

  • href – a HRef object for the link

Returns

a Path object for the target of the link.

walk(path=None)¶

Generator function to yield all pages in the index, depth first

Parameters

path – a Path object for the starting point, can be used to only iterate a sub-tree. When this is None the whole notebook is iterated over

Returns

an iterator that yields Path objects

Raises

IndexNotFoundError – if path does not exist in the index

walk_bottomup(path=None)¶

zim.notebook.index.tags module¶

Hint for MyTreeIter

class zim.notebook.index.tags.IndexTag(name, id)¶

Bases: object

Object to represent a page tag in the Index API

These are tags that appear in pages with an “@”, like “@foo”. They are indexed by the Index and represented with this class.

Variables

  • name – the name of the tag, e.g. “foo” for an “@foo” in the page

  • id – the id of this tag in the table (primary key)

id¶
name¶

class zim.notebook.index.tags.TagsTreeModelMixin(index, tags=())¶

Bases: zim.notebook.index.tags.TagsTreeModelBase

Tree model mixin class that uses tags as the toplevel

tag1
page_with_tag1

child child

…

tag2

page_with_tag2

…

If any tags are given on construction, the top level will be limitted to that set. But the model also supports showing all tags.

class zim.notebook.index.tags.TagsView(db)¶

list_all_tags()¶

Returns all tags in the index as IndexTag objects

list_all_tags_by_n_pages()¶

Returns all tags in the index as IndexTag objects

list_intersecting_tags(tags)¶

List tags that have pages in common with a given set of tags

Generator function that lists all tags that occur on pages that match the given tag set. This is used to narrow down possible tag sets that are not empty. (This method is used e.g. in the zim.plugins.tags.TagCloudWidget widget to decide which tags to show once some tags are selected.)

Parameters

tags – an iterable of IndexTag objects

Returns

yields IndexTag objects

list_pages(tag)¶

List all pages tagged with a given tag.

Parameters

tag – a tag name as string or an IndexTag object

Returns

yields PageIndexRecord objects

list_tags(path)¶

Returns all tags for a given page

Parameters

path – a Path object for the page

Returns

yields IndexTag objects

Raises

IndexNotFoundError – if path is not found in the index

class zim.notebook.index.Index(*arg, **kwarg)¶

Bases: zim.signals.SignalEmitter

The Index keeps a cache of all pages in a notebook store, all links between pages and all tags. This data is used to speed up many operatons in the user interface, like showing the notebook index in the side pane, showing “what links here” and faster search for page attributes.

The Index object is an opaque object that only exposes an API to trigger index updates and notifications when changes are found. It does not expose the data it keeps directly. To query the index, you need to construct an “index view” first, see e.g. the PagesIndexView, LinksIndexView and TagsIndexView classes. For convenience the Notebook class also exposes these three views with the respective attributes pages, links and tags.

Signal

new-update-iter (update_iter): signal used for plugins wanting to extend the indexer

Signal

changed (): emitted after changes have been committed

check_and_update()¶

Update all data in the index

check_and_update_iter()¶
check_async(notebook, paths, recursive=False)¶
file_moved(oldfile, newfile)¶
flag_reindex()¶

This methods flags all pages with content to be re-indexed. Main reason to use this would be when loading a new plugin that wants to index all pages. Differs from flush() because it does not drop all data

flush()¶

Delete all data in the index
